specs.title: Engine state
specs.description: Emergency switch to issue an all-systems halt. Only administrative functions will work if "Off" is selected.

specs.title: Website name
specs.description: Name of this website

specs.title: Meta Description
specs.description:
Text to use as default description on all pages.
It may be overriden by modules.

specs.title: Meta Keywords
specs.description:
Comma separated list of keywords for all pages.
It may be overriden by modules.

specs.title: Meta Rating
specs.description:
Rating of the website.
It may be overriden by modules.

specs.title: Meta Robots
specs.description:
Directives for robots. Full reference here.
It may be overriden by modules.

specs.title: Meta Revisit-After
specs.description:
A single expression of a period for search engines to revisit this page, E.G. 3 days, 1 month.
Defaults to 7 days
It may be overriden by modules.

specs.title: Default image
specs.description:
Specify an image to use when the page doesn't have a thumbnail set.
A good standard for an image on this case would be 1100x575.

specs.title: Default language
specs.description:
Default display language.
Important: The engine and the core modules support listed languages, but it is possible that not all the installed modules do. In such case, the fallback language will always be English/United States.

specs.title: Active template
specs.description: Template to use for all output.

specs.title: Hide left sidebar on admin pages
specs.description: If the template has left sidebar support (usually used to display frontend-related links), hide it on those pages that use the admin layout.

specs.title: Alternate admin menu layout
specs.description:
By default, the admin menu is shown on a bar above the standard menu bar.
If this option is enabled, admin menu entries will be moved into the menu bar (yet they'll remain visible for admins only).

specs.title: Main menu auto-collapse width
specs.description:
Specify the width in pixels that the browser window/display must have to collapse the main menu.
The best amount to specify here is the width of the browser window with all menu items being shown.
Defaults to 700.

specs.title: Webmaster address
specs.description: Email address where all contact requests and engine notifications should be sent to.

specs.title: Email sender name
specs.description: Name of the sender for delivery of email notifications and messages.

specs.title: Email sender address
specs.description: Email address used to deliver notificacions and messages

specs.title: Send email through SMTP
specs.description: By default, all email is sent through the local transport (usually sendmail). If you want to send email through a local or external SMTP server, enable this option and set account/connection details ahead. Click here to send a test email

specs.title: SMTP host
specs.description: IP or Hostname

specs.title: SMTP port
specs.description:
Specify the SMTP port. Hints:
• 25 is the plain text standard.
• 465 is the standard for SSL authentication.
• 587 is the standard for TLS authentication.

specs.title: SMTP account user
specs.description: Username of the SMTP account

specs.title: SMTP security
specs.description: Please select an option.

specs.title: User levels
specs.description:
List of all user levels in the system.
User levels go from 0 to 255. You can add as many levels as needed to identify your user types using the next syntax: level - name, E.G. 100 - Author.
Warning: There are 8 roles tied to specific levels: 0 - Unregistered, 1 - Unconfirmed, 10 - Newcomer, 100 - Author, 150 - VIP, 200 - Moderator, 240 - Coadmin and 255 - Admin.
You must keep these levels in the list and just change their names as needed. Plus, add any levels between them.

specs.title: User online cookie
specs.description:
Name of the cookie to store the session account id on the user's browser.
Change it to force users with an open session to re-authenticate.

specs.title: User session cookie
specs.description:
Name of the cookie to store the account id on the user's browser so the user doesn't need to login every time.
Change it to force all users (online/offline) to re-authenticate.

specs.title: reCAPTCHA secret key
specs.description:
Secret key provided by Google Recaptcha. Used to protect the engine from automated accounts creation among other things.
Visit Google reCAPTCHA to get your secret/site keypair or leave blank to disable reCAPTCHA functionality.

specs.title: reCAPTCHA site key
specs.description:
Public key provided by Google Recaptcha. Used in conjunction with the private key.
Leave blank to disable reCAPTCHA functionality.

specs.title: Maximum upload size
specs.description: Amount <u>in megabytes</u> to set for file uploads. Defaults to 10.

specs.title: Allowed upload file types
specs.description:
List of supported media types and their corresponding managers, one per line, using the following syntax: type - manager_class.
By default, allowed upload types are: png, gif, jpg/jpe/jpeg, mpg, mp4, m4v, 3gp, mov, flv, mkv, wmv, ogg, ogv and avi.
This value may be updated when a module that handles file uploads is added/removed.
Also, the manager_class must be an existing and valid class. Do not touch this value unless you know what you're doing.

specs.title: Thumbnails size
specs.description:
The image manager builds thumbnails when files are uploaded and built keeping the aspect ratio before cropping within the defined size.
Specify here the dimensions in pixels. By default, Thumbnails are managed at 460x220.

specs.title: PNG thumbnails compression
specs.description:
Specify the lossless PNG compression level used for thumbnails generation in PNG format.
Default value is 9 (best compression).

specs.title: JPEG thumbnails quality
specs.description:
Specify the quality percent used for thumbnails generation in JPEG format.
Default value is 90% (good quality with less file size).
Minimum recommended value is 40%. Anything below that will be ugly.

specs.title: FFmpeg path
specs.description:
FFmpeg is needed to handle video conversions. It must be installed in the server to support video uploads using the gallery manager.
You can download and install it on your server using the command line sudo apt-get install ffmpeg on Ubuntu/Debian or sudo yum install ffmpeg on Red Hat/CentOS.
If you have a shared hosting and can't install it on the server, you can download a static version from here and run it from your home folder.

specs.title: Debugging Display performance details
specs.description:
Display page load times and resource consumption at the footer of every page.
Warning: all users will be able to see these details!

specs.title: Debugging Query tracking
specs.description:
Allows the engine to track database queries and show a table at the end of every page, below the footer.
Warning: all users will be able to see these details!

specs.title: Debugging Query backtrace
specs.description:
When query tracking is enabled, add a column showing the PHP scripts doing the calls.
Warning: all users will be able to see these details!
